request_process.step_1: Submit written application describing records to official custodian
request_process.step_2: Agency has 3 days (excluding weekends/holidays) to respond
request_process.step_3: If not immediately available, agency schedules inspection within 5 days
request_process.step_4: If denied, agency must cite specific exemption and explain application
request_process.step_5: Appeal to Attorney General within reasonable time (no specific deadline)
request_process.step_6: AG has 20 days to review and issue written decision
request_process.step_7: Either party may appeal AG decision to Circuit Court within 30 days

fees.copying: Actual reproduction costs only (media + mechanical processing)
fees.staff_time: Cannot charge for staff time to locate/review records
fees.electronic_records: Available in useable electronic format if technically feasible
fees.payment: May require payment in advance of copying

exemptions_summary: Records specifically prohibited by federal/state law
Preliminary drafts, notes, correspondence with private individuals
Medical records and personal privacy information
Security information that could endanger life/safety
Real estate appraisals prior to acquisition

special_provisions.resident_only_enforcement: Only Kentucky residents can enforce rights through AG appeals or court action
special_provisions.taxpayer_definition: Resident includes any person, business, or entity paying or required to pay Kentucky taxes
special_provisions.liberal_construction: Exemptions must be strictly construed in favor of disclosure
special_provisions.burden_of_proof: Agency must prove exemption applies - strict burden
special_provisions.damages_available: Court may award $10-100/day for arbitrary and capricious denials
special_provisions.attorney_fees: Court costs and reasonable attorney fees if requester prevails

basic_request.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request
basic_request.body:
Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 et seq.), I hereby request to inspect and obtain copies of the following public records:

[Describe records with specificity]

As a Kentucky resident, I have the right to inspect public records under KRS 61.872. Please respond within three (3) days as required by KRS 61.880(1). If access is denied in whole or part, please provide a written statement of the specific exception authorizing withholding and explanation of how the exception applies.

Please contact me to discuss any reproduction fees.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

attorney_general_appeal.subject: Appeal Under Kentucky Open Records Act - KRS 61.880
attorney_general_appeal.body: I am appealing the denial of my open records request by [Agency Name]. On [Date], I requested [Description of Records]. On [Date], the agency denied my request citing [Exemption Claimed]. I believe this denial violates the Kentucky Open Records Act because [Reasons]. Per KRS 61.880, I request your review of this denial. All relevant correspondence is attached.

circuit_court_appeal.note: Must be filed within 30 days of Attorney General's decision
circuit_court_appeal.jurisdiction: Circuit Court where agency is located or where records are maintained
circuit_court_appeal.standard: De novo review - fresh determination of all issues
